meanings.definition: (adjective) having a red or flushed complexion
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun all day, her face was blowzed.
meanings.sent2: The blowzed cheeks of the child showed how much fun they had.
meanings.sent3: The blowzed look on his face made him appear as if he had just run a marathon.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with blowzed hues, casting a warm glow over the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Her blowzed complexion was a clear sign of her enjoyment under the sun.

meanings.definition: (verb) to make red or flushed in complexion
meanings.sent1: The hot weather blowzed her cheeks as she walked through the park.
meanings.sent2: The excitement of the surprise party blowzed her face with happiness.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally blowzed his face by using too much spicy sauce in his meal.
meanings.sent4: The painter's brush seemed to blowze the canvas with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The cold wind blowzed her cheeks, turning them a rosy shade.
